q: , the visionary Page rather than the seasoned manager Eric Schmidt was urgently needed to combat the threat from Facebook, which is controlled by 26-year-old wunderkind Mark Zuckerberg . Google couched the announcement in terms of management clarity and efficiency( We'll operate and execute even better in Eric Schmidt 's words), but the real need is to reestablish the entrepreneurial drive that is propelling Facebook. world's most- used search engine, generating$ 29 billion in sales last year. "Larry is ready," Eric Schmidt , who will become executive chairman, said today on a conference call. It's time for him to have a shot at running this. Eric Schmidt , 55, who joined the company in 2001, will focus on deals, partnerships and customers, he wrote in a blog post. Page will take over day-to-day operations as CEO on April 4

confirmed that it would be proper for the attorney general to obtain the views of ministers on the national interest before reaching his own independent decision. Ministers' views would be passed to the DPP and he would then exercise independent judgment, taking on board the serious considerations that have been given to the matter by other ministers and the attorney general. All this strikes me as perfectly proper. Before authorising the arrest and detention of a visiting politician such as Henry Kissinger or Donald Rumsfeld , the DPP would take into account any views expressed by William Hague or Liam Fox

appeared to be phoning it in for much of the year-- something he recently confirmed to Oprah Winfrey . Appearing on Oprah Winfrey 's show, Simon Cowell said he had grown "bored" with "Idol." There were too many times, Oprah Winfrey , where I was sitting there bored, and I thought, "The end of the day, the audience doesn't tune in to watch me being bored. Of late, Sergio Marchionne is sounding increasingly optimistic about Chrysler as its fortunes improve, with U.S. sales rising 17 percent last year. I think our presence in Chrysler could not have been forecast, and certainly in hindsight it was probably one of the best things that could have happened to Fiat, he said last week in Italy. "I think it is also one of the best things that could have happened to Chrysler, too."------ AP Business Writer Colleen Barry in Milan
